definition: thoughts surging in one's mind (idiom)/different thoughts coming to mind

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: Albert's thoughts whirled, and he was thrilled and excited.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾伯特思潮起伏，心情激動。

sentences.english: I feel very emotional to be standing here and think of what it will become.
sentences.chinese: 我此刻站在這裏，想到將來，思潮起伏。

sentences.english: The same heart, think again of motherland.
sentences.chinese: 心裏思潮起伏，又想到故國了。

definition: one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
to remain puzzled after pondering over sth a hundred times (idiom)/to remain perplexed despite much thought
cannot control oneself (idiom)/to be beside oneself
to ponder a solution/to consider (the best move, how to find a way etc)
lit. to be frustrated as though having lost sth (idiom)/fig. to be at a loss/perplexed/frustrated
